meanings.definition: Relating to or concerning a person's character or personality traits.
meanings.sent1: Her characterological traits include honesty and kindness.
meanings.sent2: The psychologist conducted a characterological assessment of the patient.
meanings.sent3: It was characterological of him to always offer help to those in need.
meanings.sent4: His characterological depth was as vast as the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The characterological differences between the twins were striking.

meanings.definition: Involving the study or analysis of an individual's character or personality.
meanings.sent1: The characterological research focused on behavior patterns.
meanings.sent2: She pursued a career in characterological psychology.
meanings.sent3: The characterological investigation revealed surprising insights.
meanings.sent5: The characterological analysis provided valuable insights.

meanings.definition: Describing a person's inherent qualities or characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The characterological traits of the protagonist made him relatable.
meanings.sent2: The author's writing style was characterologically unique.
meanings.sent3: It was characterological of her to always wear colorful socks.
meanings.sent4: Her characterological essence shone through in her artwork.
meanings.sent5: The characterological charm of the old house was undeniable.
